page.title: 17Wealthy Living
page.content: The existence of a number of very large houses,e.g. Daglingworth Manor, The Dower House, Chantry House, The Old Rectory, etc; the conversion of several old barns into luxury dwellings, and the renovating of cottages sold-off by the Duchy of Cornwall(often converting two cottages into one large dwelling), has led to a number of comparatively wealthy people living in the area. Some of them enjoy local hunting and shooting activities. Their social life is influenced by the equestrian atmosphere of the surrounding areas (where several of the Royal Families have their residences) e.g.3-Day Eventing at Badminton, Polo at Cirencester, horse shows, trials, eventing etc. on the Bathurst and Vestey Estates and at Gatcombe Park, home of Princess Anne.
